title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Word of the Week: The swashbuckling origins and evolution of 'filibuster'

items.title: Major deal wipes out $30 billion in medical debt. Even backers say it's not enough
items.description: Undue Medical Debt is retiring unpaid medical bills for 20 million people. The debt trading company that owned them is leaving the market.

items.title: The unique genetic change that turned horses into athletic powerhouses
items.description: A new study suggests genetic changes allow horses to produce more energy, while minimizing the toll the energy takes on cells.

items.title: South Korean court removes impeached president over martial law declaration
items.description: Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol was removed from office four months after he declared martial law, sending troops into parliament.

items.title: TV's Dr Oz confirmed to lead Medicare and Medicaid
items.description: Oz, who has never held public office, is best known for hosting US daytime TV show The Dr Oz Show.

items.title: South Korea's president has been removed from power: What happens now?
items.description: The constitutional court unanimously upheld the impeachment of Yoon Suk Yeol.

items.title: Celebrations and sorrow as South Korea president removed from office

items.title: Dow plunges more than 1,600 points as stocks recoil from tariff shock
items.description: Nasdaq also sinks more than 1,000 points as investors fret over the potential economic impact of President Trump's latest tariffs.

items.title: Bollywood actor and director Manoj Kumar dies at 87
items.description: Manoj Kumar was best known for his patriotic films in the 1960s and 1970s.

items.title: U.S. tourist lands on forbidden island to give Diet Coke to remote tribe

items.title: Libya expels aid groups accused of 'African' population plot
items.description: The groups, including the UN refugee agency, are accused of trying to change Libya's "demographic composition".
